tool.name: OSMGPFeatureComparison

param.name: in_sourceFeatures
param.dialogReference: The source feature class assumed to contain the data to be compared to the OpenStreetMap data.
param.pythonReference: The source feature class assumed to contain the data to be compared to the OpenStreetMap data.

param.name: in_number_of_intersections_field
param.displayname: Field to store number of intersections
param.dialogReference: An attribute field in the source feature class to store the number of intersections between the source and the matching feature. The field needs to be of type integer. A number of 0 indicates that the source does not intersect any other feature, suggestiong that the source has no matching entity in the match feature class, making it ok to import. The higher the number of intersections, the more features are geometrically similar and special considerations for imports are required.
param.pythonReference: An attribute field in the source feature class to store the number of intersections between the source and the matching feature. The field needs to be of type integer. A number of 0 indicates that the source does not intersect any other feature, suggestiong that the source has no matching entity in the match feature class, making it ok to import. The higher the number of intersections, the more features are geometrically similar and special considerations for imports are required.

param.name: in_intersected_ids_field
param.displayname: Field to store intersected feature OIDs
param.dialogReference: An attribute field in the source feature class to store the enumerations of object IDs of intersected features from the match feature class. The fields needs to be of type string. The list of object IDs is comma separated.
param.pythonReference: An attribute field in the source feature class to store the enumerations of object IDs of intersected features from the match feature class. The fields needs to be of type string. The list of object IDs is comma separated.

param.name: in_matchFeatures
param.dialogReference: A feature class to which to compare the source. In the context of the ArcGIS Editor for OpenStreetMap the match feature class is one of created feature classes containing the OSM data.
param.pythonReference: A feature class to which to compare the source. In the context of the ArcGIS Editor for OpenStreetMap the match feature class is one of created feature classes containing the OSM data.

tool.summary: This tool allows the user to compare two feature classes to determine the similarity between the two feature representations.
tool.usage: The source feature class is geometrically compared to the match feature class. The number of intersections between the source and the match feature class are suggested to indicate a degree of similarity between the two feature representations. The higher the number of intersections the higher the possibility that the compared features are similar.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This tool allows the user to compare two feature classes to determine the similarity between the two feature representations.
